main event: A bright, high-altitude, fast-moving, luminous object was observed in Cleveland, Ohio.
interesting points: The object shone with brightness compared to that of a star., It was observed at an altitude of about 50-60 miles., The object traveled at high speed for approximately 2-3 minutes., The object was headed northeast at an azimuth of 50° and elevation of 40°., Witnesses reported no distinct sounds during the observation.
sighted object: a bright, high-altitude, fast-moving luminous object
witness description: the witness observed the object for several minutes, believing it to be larger than a star or planet
